required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Registry Study Evaluating Outcomes in Breast Biopsy With the Intact™ Breast Lesion Excision System (BLES)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center Registry Study Evaluating Outcomes in Breast Biopsy With the Intact™ Breast Lesion Excision System (BLES)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this registry study is to collect use and clinical outcomes data following breast lesion excision or sampling with the Intact BLES.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Product withdrawn from the market due to a shift in sponsor business focus

primary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks prior to the Intact procedure
Weeks prior to the Intact procedure
Weeks prior to the Intact procedure

primary_outcome.measure: Tissue margin (as reported from histology) rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks after the Intact procedure, up to approximately 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Procedure margin vs. margin size, measured in mm

primary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks after the Intact procedure, up to approximately 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Compared to maximum lesion size, measured in mm

arm_group.arm_group_label: Females, 18 years of age or older
arm_group.description: Females, 18 years of age or older, who will undergo the Intact procedure

intervention.description: Intact BLES is an automated, percutaneous biopsy device capable of delivering a surgical quality specimen for histological review of breast abnormalities. It is uniquely suited to maintain lesion architecture within the biopsy sample, providing an opportunity for pathological assessment and the potential avoidance of an open surgical procedure.
intervention.arm_group_label: Females, 18 years of age or older

study_pop.textblock: Subjects who have undergone the Intact procedure that are female and 18 years of age or older.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- Age ≥ 18 years
- BIRADS ≤ 5, as initially imaged
- Subject is willing and capable of providing informed consent and has a scheduled or planned breast lesion excision or sampling where the Intact BLES is expected to be used
Exclusion Criteria:
- Male
- Subjects with subglandular (pre-pectoral, or "single plane") breast implants
- Subjects with electronic implantable devices (such as pacemakers and defibrillators)
- Subjects who are contraindicated for surgery due to factors such as anti-coagulant use which cannot be safely reversed

facility.name: The Breast Center at Chesapeake Regional Healthcare
